subject: Relationships
title: Cohabitation: Marriage Without the Paper
description: A fast breakdown of Cohabitation: Marriage Without the Paper for builders.

hook.text: They've lived together for 12 years and raised two kids. They're not married. Does the paper really matter?

buildup.text: Cohabitation tripled since the 1990s. In Scandinavia, more children are born to cohabiting couples than married ones.

discovery.text: Cohabiting couples have fewer legal protections: no automatic inheritance, shared healthcare, or property rights.

twist.text: Some countries created legal frameworks for cohabitants. France's PACS is now more popular than marriage.

climax.text: Commitment doesn't require a marriage license. But legal protection still often does. The gap is closing slowly.

punchline.text: Cohabitation is the new norm. Legal frameworks are slowly catching up.

quiz.question: What is France's PACS?
options: A legal framework for cohabiting couples
